para.text: Notwithstanding part B of subchapter XII-A of this chapter, the Deputy Mayor for Planning and Economic Development ("Deputy Mayor") may award grants from the Vitality Fund established pursuant to § 1-325.451 to attract businesses to the District or retain businesses in the District, with a preference for attraction to or retention in the District's central business district.
Grants awarded pursuant to this section may be used for the following purposes:
To cover operational costs;
As down-payment assistance or to subsidize rent;
To pay for tenant improvements;
To cover workforce training or professional development costs not eligible for support through other workforce programs; and
To cover recruitment and hiring costs.
To be eligible to receive a grant under this section, a business must:
Demonstrate that the retention or attraction of its business will have a significant positive economic impact on the District, which may be evidenced by the following factors:
New jobs;
Retained jobs;
Total employment;
Average annual wages;
Term of occupancy;
Net new square feet occupied;
Total square feet occupied;
Dollar amount of capital investment;
Tax revenue;
Return on investment;
Contribution of the company's presence in the District to the growth of the company's industry in the District; or
Other outcomes identified by the Deputy Mayor that quantify the economic impact of the business's project on the District.
Require its employees, in the aggregate, to be on-site at a location in the District for at least 50% of their work hours; and
Agree to:
Develop or participate in a workforce development program that offers District residents opportunities for training or employment within the business or the industry in which it operates; or
Spend at least 5% of its total annual contracting with businesses eligible for certification as local business enterprises, pursuant to § 2-218.31.

By January 1, 2026, and annually thereafter, the Deputy Mayor shall submit to the Council a report that contains the following information on grants awarded pursuant to this section in the prior calendar year:
For each grantee:
The name of the business, the location of the business, and the grant amount;
The number of jobs created or retained as a result of the grants and the average annual wages of the jobs created or retained;
The total number of persons employed by the grantee;
The square footage leased or occupied by the grantee;
The dollar amount of capital investments made by the grantee, if applicable;
The return on investment for all grants awarded; and
Any other information the Deputy Mayor deems necessary to demonstrate the impact of the grants on the economic vitality of the District.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 2013(d) of Fiscal Year 2025 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2024 (D.C. Act 25-506, July 15, 2024, 71 DCR 8406).
